subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Paul's keyboard proposal (withdrawn)
msgSnippet: ... I myself find B = #37 and q = #35 to be equally weak, and second only to R = half-#4, and I think I make this clear in my document.  Clearly some uneasy
messageBody:
On 4.1.2008 Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
> I find the assignment of B to #37 to be the weakest in BPJ2.

I myself find B = #37 and q = #35 to be equally weak, and
second only to R = half-#4, and I think I make this clear
in my document. Clearly some uneasy assignments will be
necessary, but I've tried to provide memory cues --
rationalizations if you will -- even for these, which IMHO
beats totally arbitrary odd-man-out mappings. In other
words: I know they are weak, but hope they are not totally
powerless.


/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
No man forgets his original trade: the rights of
nations and of kings sink into questions of grammar,
if grammarians discuss them.
-Dr. Samuel Johnson (1707 - 1784)

On 4.1.2008 Ted Larson Freeman wrote:
> I find the assignment of B to #37 to be the weakest in BPJ2.

I myself find B = #37 and q = #35 to be equally weak, and 
second only to R = half-#4, and I think I make this clear
in my document.  Clearly some uneasy assignments will be
necessary, but I've tried to provide memory cues --
rationalizations if you will -- even for these, which IMHO
beats totally arbitrary odd-man-out mappings.  In other
words: I know they are weak, but hope they are not totally
powerless.


/BP 8^)>
